lines.content: - **Purpose**: Code quality improvement, debugging, and feature implementation
- Refactoring long methods (>40 lines) into smaller, focused methods
- Identifying methods that violated the Single Level of Abstraction Principle
- Extracting nested logic into separate private methods
- Generating appropriate method names for extracted code blocks
- ✅ AI excelled at identifying logical breakpoints in long methods
- ✅ Generated meaningful method names that reflected the extracted logic
- ✅ Preserved all assertions and error handling during extraction
- ✅ Maintained original functionality while improving readability
- ✅ SLAP principles were applied consistently across all refactored classes
- Methods that combined validation, processing, and formatting were the best candidates for SLAP refactoring
- Method length decreased by an average of 60-70% after refactoring

The SLAP refactoring significantly improved code maintainability. The AI was particularly helpful in suggesting logical extraction points and maintaining consistency across similar refactoring patterns. The biggest challenge was knowing when to stop extracting - not every 5-line block needs its own method. The principle of "one level of abstraction per method" was a good guiding rule.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Mintel.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Mintel.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face
* and a label containing text from the speaker.
assert text != null : "Dialog text cannot be null";
assert img != null : "Dialog image cannot be null";

assert img.getHeight() > 0 : "Image must have positive height";
assert dialog != null : "FXML: 'dialog' Label not injected";
assert displayPicture != null : "FXML: 'displayPicture' ImageView not injected";
assert false : "Failed to load DialogBox FXML: " + e.getMessage();
assert dialog.getText().equals(text) : "Dialog text not set correctly";
assert !dialog.getText().isEmpty() : "Dialog text should not be empty";

assert displayPicture.isPreserveRatio() : "Preserve ratio should be true";

assert tmp.get(1) == original.get(0) : "Second element not swapped correctly";

assert dialog.getStyleClass().contains("reply-label") : "Reply style class not added to dialog";

* Main class for the Mintel chatbot application.
* Mintel is a task management chatbot that helps users track todos, deadlines, and events.
* It supports saving tasks to file and loading them on startup.
* Constructs a Mintel chatbot instance with the specified file path for data storage.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks will be saved/loaded.
assert filePath != null : "File path must not be null";
assert !filePath.trim().isEmpty() : "File path must not be empty";
assert ui != null : "UI must be initialized before loading tasks";
assert storage != null : "Storage must be initialized before loading tasks";
ui.showMessage("What can I do for you?");
ui.showMessage("File is not in correct format!");
ui.showMessage("Do you want to overwrite file? If yes, enter \"y\". If no, enter \"n\".");
ui.showMessage("Got it! File will be overwrite once a valid task is given!");
ui.showMessage("Please change the file to the correct format or rename the file before trying again!");
ui.showMessage("That is an invalid command! Please change the file to the correct format or"

assert tasks != null : "TaskList must be initialized before running";
assert ui != null : "UI must be initialized before running";
assert storage != null : "Storage must be initialized before running";

assert input != null : "Input to getResponse() cannot be null";
assert tasks != null : "TaskList must be initialized";
assert ui != null : "UI must be initialized";
assert storage != null : "Storage must be initialized";
return response + "\n(The window will close automatically after 3 seconds)";
* The entry point of the Mintel application.
* Exception thrown when the 'From' date is after the 'To' date.
* Used by Event class for date validation.
* Constructs an DateLogicException with a custom error message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the date error.
super("The 'From' date should be before the 'To' date!");
* Exception thrown when description of the Task classes are empty.
* Used by Todo, Deadline and Event class for paramater validation.
* Constructs an EmptyDescriptionException with a custom error message.
* @param taskType The Task class with missing description.
super("The description of a " + taskType + " cannot be empty! ; _ ;");
* Exception thrown when an invalid command is given.
* Used by Parser class for command validation.
* Constructs an InvalidCommandException with an error message.
* Exception thrown when a date string cannot be parsed into a valid date.
* Used by Deadline and Event classes for date validation.
* Constructs an InvalidDateFormatException with a custom error message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the date format error.
super("Date format is invalid! Format example: 2026-02-26");
* Base exception class for all Mintel-specific exceptions.
* Provides a consistent way to handle errors in the Mintel application.
* Constructs a MintelException with the specified error message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the error.
* Exception thrown when a parameter required in the Task classes are empty.
* Used by Todo, Deadline and Event class for paramater validation.
* Constructs an MissingParameterException with a custom error message.
* @param message The parameter missing in the command.
super("You are missing the " + message + " parameter! ; _ ;");
* Exception thrown when the index given is out of range.
* Used by functions Mark, Unmark and Delete.
* Constructs an OutOfRangeException with an error message.
super("That is more than the number of tasks in the list! ; _ ;");

* Executes the command with the given task list, UI, and storage by adding a new Event Task to the task list.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving tasks.
* @throws MintelException If there's an error during command execution.
* @throws IOException     If there's an error saving tasks to file.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)

Event event = new Event(name, from, to);
assert event.getName().equals(name) : "Event name not set correctly";

assert tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1) == event : "Event not at end of list";
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + event
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
